climbs.name: For People Who Like Big Holds

content.description: Start standing, and climb the slab via large pockets and huecos. It is a fun option for newer climbers.
content.protection: A pad or two is ideal.
content.location:
This climbs the obvious, slabby line of huecos about 10 feet left of '

Bert's Butt

'.

content.description:
Start crouched with hands matched on the lowest undercling. Establish feet on the wall and bump to the next undercling. Match and make a difficult move (or series of moves) to get to the obvious, chalked jug. From the jug, move up and left to another large jug/shelf and then upwards to an easy top out.

It's hard to say what the crux move is. It seems different for different people. No matter what, it's a lot of powerful moves in a row. The move to the second good shelf can be a bit of a heartbreaker, especially on the flash burn, since it's not as straightforward as it seems. I won't spoil the fun of figuring it out!
content.protection: A couple of pads are ideal.
content.location: This is located in the middle of the overhang on the west face of the boulder. Begin on the underclings deep in the back of the overhang.
